Hello, has any team made or knows a method for making bumpers with elastic covers for color swapping?

I’ve thought about it. But our team has reversible bumpers with two pieces of fabric sewn together.

This is a bad picture, but I hope it helps.

IMG_20250213_1243181280×720 53.8 KB

Yes, we’ve done it once. 0.5/5 Would not recommend it.
It’s really hard to get them tight enough to not look saggy and horrible, yet loose enough to be able to stretch over the frame in the first place.

Which bumper fabric did you use to make it possible to pass the elastic through the hem?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-14T13:58:42.796Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":21.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491568,"topic_slug":"elastic-bumper","display_username":"Ana Luiza Almeida","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16614,"username":"MrBasse","name":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73428,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/elastic-bumper/491568/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3526989,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T14:05:00.974Z","cooked":"

We’ve used several kinds over the years. We used cheap canvas from Joann Fabrics for years but stepped up to Cordura after seeing lots of tears and ugly colors on our bots.

The hem is sewn in by us, a lot of people who complain about how hard the reversible bumpers are just haven’t ever upholstered or sewn before, it is definitely an art. I’ve made seat covers for cars and boats and made a upholstered chair or two in college so I had some experience. I’m not good at sewing. We usually have parent or student who is better than I am take over to save us from me sewing.

Patterns changed a lot this year with square corners for us, but he basic set up can be seen in this ancient video (man I had a lot more hair back then…): https://youtu.be/XYTiRxLw7oA?si=OhoC_Pwf6poyssXZ
